docs.snippet: Advertising in eight major New York newspapers during the first seven months of this year totaled 83,332,259 lines, a gain of 4.94 perh)0*0*0*icent over the similar period of last year, according to an analysis of Media Records figures. Categories...
docs.lead_paragraph: Advertising in eight major New York newspapers during the first seven months of this year totaled 83,332,259 lines, a gain of 4.94 perh)0*0*0*icent over the similar period of last year, according to an analysis of Media Records figures. Categories showing gains were automotive, 27.31 per cent; retail, 7.74 per cent, and classified, 0.50 per cent.

headline.main: Advertising News and Notes; Named Vice President By Broadalbin Knitting Co.

docs.snippet: THIS is an account, in diary form, of a newspaper man's six months' tour of Cuba and eight of the nine South American countries, covering June, 1947, to January, 1948. It is a generally well-informed, easily read, journalistic survey of contemporary...
docs.lead_paragraph: THIS is an account, in diary form, of a newspaper man's six months' tour of Cuba and eight of the nine South American countries, covering June, 1947, to January, 1948. It is a generally well-informed, easily read, journalistic survey of contemporary conditions, more comprehensive than profound, but at least the work of a competent, hard-working reporter who has lived and labored at his profession in the territory he covers.

headline.main: The Good Neighbors Now; LATIN AMERICA: Continent in Crisis. By Ray Josephs. 503 pp. New York: Random House. $4.50. The Good Neighbors Now

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Aug. 21 -- Eight countries that did not negotiate tariff reductions in Geneva last year have expressed interest in the new negotiations to be sponsored by twenty-two signers of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, it was announced here...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Aug. 21 -- Eight countries that did not negotiate tariff reductions in Geneva last year have expressed interest in the new negotiations to be sponsored by twenty-two signers of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, it was announced here today.
docs.abstract: Govt to consider ITO charter before accepting Geneva Tariff Agreement

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 -- Six European countries, the Allied occupation zones of Germany and China have received authorizations to obtain $81,393,807 in commodities, materials and foodstuffs under our global aid program, the Economic Cooperation...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 -- Six European countries, the Allied occupation zones of Germany and China have received authorizations to obtain $81,393,807 in commodities, materials and foodstuffs under our global aid program, the Economic Cooperation Administration said today.
docs.abstract: ECA approves allocations; recipients, items and their sources listed

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market had proceeded quietly and without incident for the better part of the week, or until Thursday, when New Zealand announced the immediate restoration of her currency to parity with the British pound. Since 1933, the cross...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market had proceeded quietly and without incident for the better part of the week, or until Thursday, when New Zealand announced the immediate restoration of her currency to parity with the British pound. Since 1933, the cross rate had been 125 New Zealand pounds to 100 sterling.

docs.snippet: Panama led Cuba by one point to take top position in both credit and collections in the first half of 1948, according to the fortieth semi-annual survey of commercial credit and collection conditions in Latin-American markets by the foreign credit...
docs.lead_paragraph: Panama led Cuba by one point to take top position in both credit and collections in the first half of 1948, according to the fortieth semi-annual survey of commercial credit and collection conditions in Latin-American markets by the foreign credit interchange bureau of the National Association of Credit Men.

headline.main: PANAMA NOW FIRST IN TRADE STANDING; Credit and Collections Survey Shows Brazil and Argentina in Decline for Half Year

docs.snippet: The Navy announced yesterday that the 27,000-ton aircraft carrier Leyte would hold high speed maneuvers off the entrance to New York Harbor between 2 P.M. and 6 P.M. Sunday and warned all vessels, particularly pleasure craft, to avoid the area.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Navy announced yesterday that the 27,000-ton aircraft carrier Leyte would hold high speed maneuvers off the entrance to New York Harbor between 2 P.M. and 6 P.M. Sunday and warned all vessels, particularly pleasure craft, to avoid the area.

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market during the past week experienced one of the dullest periods in some time. Business reported was very light and mostly routine. Quotations fluctuated within an extremely narrow range and changes for the most part were...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market during the past week experienced one of the dullest periods in some time. Business reported was very light and mostly routine. Quotations fluctuated within an extremely narrow range and changes for the most part were slight.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP) -A new weekly allotment of $57,477,236 in Marshall Plan aid was reported today, about 67 per cent of it for industrial "recovery" goods instead of food.
